reasoning: Renal tubular necrosis (ATN) is the pathological manifestation of acute kidney injury, estimated at ~5-10% of acute kidney injuries in hospital settings. Global AKI incidence ~1-3 per 100k person-years; ATN comprises estimated 5.5 per 100k as a specific pathological subtype. Confidence limited due to ATN being pathological process rather than independent disease entity and variation based on hospital vs community settings.
source: Schrier RW et al. (2004). Acute renal failure: definitions, diagnosis, pathogenesis, and therapy. J Clin Invest. 114(1):5-14
